intro: Salvia, commonly known as sage, is a genus of flowering plants in the mint family, Lamiaceae. It is characterized by its square, often hairy stems and showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. Many species of Salvia are native to the temperate regions of the Americas, with a few species found in Europe and Asia. The leaves are typically aromatic and can vary in shape from lance-shaped to ovate. Salvia plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are also used in traditional medicine.
